t: Amazon.com: Planters Original Cheez Balls Cheese Flavored Snacks (2.75 oz Canister)
s: I disagree with other reviews claiming ... the same cheez balls we all remember. Granted, my epicurean memory does not extend far enough back with sufficient clarity to say for certain the recipe has changed, but these balls do scratch my nostalgic itch for the Planters of antiquity. They are more expensive than other cheese balls from other brands, but I feel ...

t: Planters Is Selling Cheez Balls for the First Time in Over a Decade
s: June 27, 2018 - While there are plenty of cheese ball brands on the market today, the Planters variety still maintains a cult-like following years after it was discontinued. A petition on Change.org to "bring back Planters Cheez Balls" has 819 supporters. A Facebook group with over 2200 likes makes a similar plea (with a lot more exclamation points). Planters has heard the outcry, and is rolling out a new generation of Cheez Balls through Walmart.com and Amazon ...

Planters is passing off fakes to us Cheese Ball loyalists. Anyone who says these taste the same is not being honest with themselves. Buy a can if you want to but I'm telling you, you will be disappointed. Niki M. &#183 July 9, 2019 ... The flavor doesnt even come close to the old cheez balls.

t: Don't recommend..nothing like Planters cheese balls.
s: I grew up with a Planters cheese ball addiction and even after all these years, I can recall the exact flavor, texture, and balance of saltiness off the top of my head. Til this day, I still don't understand why they discontinued them. Seriously, they were the BEST snack I ever had growing up! We searched long and far for a Planters replacement, and found 4 options. We lined them up and had a Planters Substitute taste test. Unfortunately, Utz came dead last of the 4 brands ...
